tweet: Proud to announce nearly a half million dollars in broadband funding for Jim Hogg County on #RuralBroadbandDay. We need to invest more in rural and digital infrastructure to ensure that no person in rural America is left behind. https://gonzalez.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-vicente-gonzalez-announces-nearly-500000-broadband-jim-hogg-county …

Today in 1965, President LBJ signed #Medicare & #Medicaid into law providing access to quality, affordable healthcare for millions of Americans. Healthcare is a human right & I promise to fight to ensure that no one in #TX15 is denied access to healthcare b/c it is too expensive. pic.twitter.com/7jauumQjBz

As @HouseDemocrats pass the 200 day milestone, we have delivered transformative progress on our promises #ForThePeople. From increased infrastructure spending to protecting people w/ pre-existing conditions, I promise to continue fighting on behalf of #TX15. pic.twitter.com/l9Y2ApxX61

.@USDA_NRCS has begun accepting applications for funding for conservation easements on flood prone lands. Given the two years of devastating flooding in Central and South Texas, I encourage our landowners in #TX15 to apply for these grants. https://gonzalez.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-gonzalez-encourages-south-and-central-texans-apply-usda-assistance …

On Thursday, I testified before @EnergyCommerce on the PHAIR Pricing Act introduced by myself and @RepDougCollins This bipartisan bill would increase transparency in our drug supply chain, lower prescription drug costs for seniors & protect our community pharmacists. pic.twitter.com/UPb9d1H1TM

Today, we celebrate the 29th anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act. This bill outlawed discrimination based on disability and promoted accessibility in public spaces. Equality and inclusivity is critical for our country to thrive. #ADA29 pic.twitter.com/RbtNSb3S0b

On Wednesday, I joined my colleagues to introduce a bipartisan bill that would ensure fairness for Social Security benefits payments for our teachers, firefighters and other public servants. No one should be penalized for serving their community. https://gonzalez.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-gonzalez-brady-and-bipartisan-group-lawmakers-introduce-bill …

Today, we celebrate the interns of past and present who have come through my office. On behalf of the 15th District of Texas, I thank you for your service. Happy #NationalInternDay! pic.twitter.com/W2NymykQrY

GREAT NEWS! The House just passed the bipartisan #StopBadRobocalls Act to stop the onslaught of robocalls once and for all. This comprehensive bill requires every call to be verified, allows the blocking of spam calls, and empowers @FCC to protect Americans from scammers. pic.twitter.com/6HT1s9KGO9

Today, the @NSF awarded a grant to @utrgv for scientists to better study the origins of the universe. I will continue to do all I can to provide them with resources for research and development to continue their advancements in observing space and time. https://gonzalez.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-gonzalez-announces-almost-375000-national-science-foundation-grant …

We were honored to present a U.S. flag to the Amado Garcia family at his memorial service in Benavides. Mr. Garcia lived a life of service as a Marine, Vietnam War veteran and firefighter for 30 years. Thank you for your service & rest in peace. pic.twitter.com/oZj7RGqFkd

This is the longest period in history without an increase in the minimum wage. On Thursday, I voted YES on the #RaisetheWage Act, which would gradually raise the minimum wage to $15 by 2025. #ForThePeople https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/18/us/politics/minimum-wage.html …

Today, we commemorate #MandelaDay and celebrate his legacy as a warrior for social justice, equality, peace & reconciliation. As a global community, we should honor the values of @NelsonMandela of volunteering and service in our own communities. pic.twitter.com/SwPk9E2kyu

The #CARIDAD Act allows outside groups to donate clothes, toothbrushes, supplies & aid to  federal detention facilities. Current US law prohibits outside donations. All people no matter who they are or where they come from deserve decency & respect. https://www.themonitor.com/2019/07/11/gonzalez-introduces-legislation-allow-donations-detention-facilities/ …
Great to see @comcast also lead the charge on the #robocall scourge. https://corporate.comcast.com/press/releases/att-comcast-announce-anti-robocalling-fraud-milestone-believed-to-be-nations-first …

Today, I introduced the CARIDAD Act to allow the US government to accept donations for detained kids & families. All humans, no matter who they are, have the right to be treated with decency & respect.

 https://gonzalez.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-gonzalez-introduces-caridad-act-allow-donations-children-and … pic.twitter.com/Z9ALUQc6l2
